alert.note: Alert for Furnas (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 06 at 7:44PM CDT until April 06 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 8 PM CDT THURSDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Northwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. * WHERE...In Kansas, Phillips, Smith, Rooks and Osborne Counties. In Nebraska, Dawson, Gosper, Phelps, Furnas and Harlan Counties. * WHEN...For the first High Wind Warning, this expires at 8 PM CDT this evening. For the second High Wind Warning, in effect from 7 AM to 8 PM CDT Thursday. For the Blowing Dust Advisory, this expires at 8 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
